title: Mike Feuer
added: On the City Council, Feuer chaired the Budget and Finance Committee,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://beverlypress.com/2016/04/mike-feuer/|title=Mike Feuer: City attorney champions social justice while remaining tough on crime|date=April 25, 2016|website=Park Labrea News/ Beverly Press}}</ref> and wrote key City ethics reform measures.<ref>Hugo Martin and Kay Hwangbo, "Feuer Brings Furor to L.A.", ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' (January 16, 1996), p. A-3.</ref>

title: Mike Feuer
added: Feuer sued [[Southern California Gas Company]] (SoCalGas) over the massive [[Aliso Canyon gas leak]]. The suit was later joined by the [[Attorney General of California]], [[Kamala Harris]], and by Los Angeles County. In 2018 SoCalGas settled, agreeing to payments of $119.5 million to several government entities over the incident,<ref>{{cite news |last=Domonske|first=Camila|date=8 August 2018|title=California Company Reaches $119.5 Million Settlement Over Massive Gas Leak|url=https://www.npr.org/2018/08/08/636779692/california-company-reaches-119-5-million-settlement-over-massive-gas-leak|work= |location= |access-date=17 August 2018}}</ref> much of which was devoted to long-term public health projects.   <ref>https://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-aliso-canyon-settlement-20180808-story.html</ref>

title: Mike Feuer
added: He has conducted public awareness campaigns to warn the public not to leave their pets alone in their cars.<ref>https://losangeles.cbslocal.com/2017/07/18/pet-hot-car/</ref>

title: Mike Feuer
added: He has conducted public awareness campaigns to warn the public not to leave their pets alone in their cars,<ref>https://losangeles.cbslocal.com/2017/07/18/pet-hot-car/</ref> and to be aware of puppy scams online.<ref>https://www.lamag.com/citythinkblog/puppy-scams/</ref>

title: Mike Feuer
